Package com.gemalto.idp.mobile.oob

Class OobModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gemalto.idp.mobile.oob.OobModule
  • public class OobModule
extends Object
    OobModule class which is the entry-point for OOB features.
    Since:
    4.0

      • create

        public static OobModule create()
        Create OobModule object.
        Returns:
        Oob Module.
        Since:

      • createOobManager

        public OobManager createOobManager​(URL oobUrl,
                                   String domain,
                                   String applicationId,
                                   byte[] rsaExponent,
                                   byte[] rsaModulus)
        Create OobManager object.
        Parameters:
        oobUrl - the URL of the OOB server.
        domain - the domain to use for requests to the OOB server. It must be compliant with server configuration on back-end side.
        applicationId - the application identifier to use for requests to the OOB server.
        rsaExponent - the RSA public exponent to use to communicate with the OOB server.
        rsaModulus - the RSA modules to use to communicate with the OOB server.
        Returns:
        OobManager.
        Since:
        4.0

      • createOobManager

        public OobManager createOobManager​(URL oobUrl,
                                   String domain,
                                   String applicationId,
                                   RSAPublicKey publicKey)
        Create OobManager object.
        Parameters:
        oobUrl - the URL of the OOB server.
        domain - the domain to use for requests to the OOB server. It must be compliant with server configuration on back-end side.
        applicationId - the application identifier to use for requests to the OOB server.
        publicKey - The RSA public key to communicate with OOB server.
        Returns:
        OobManager.
        Since:
        4.0

      • reset

        public boolean reset​(String applicationId)
        Deprecated.
        Cleanup the data associated with Oob module. All registered client will be removed for the given applicationId.
        Parameters:
        applicationId - the applicationId.
        Returns:
        true if reset is successful.
        Since:
        4.9.0
        See Also:
        IdpCore.reset(), IdpCore.resetSDK(ResetModule)

      • isMigrationNeededForAndroidQ

        public boolean isMigrationNeededForAndroidQ​(String applicationId)
        Check if the migration is needed for Android Q with the given application identifier. If the migration is needed, app should ask the end user for the permission READ_PHONE_STATE and then call the migration API migrateForAndroidQ(String).

        NOTE: This API should be called during the application startup to make sure that the permission popup, if any, will not interfere with other business flow.

        For more information on Android Q privacy changes, refer to https://developer.android.com/preview/privacy/data-identifiers#device-ids

        Parameters:
        applicationId - The application ID.
        Returns:
        true if migration is needed.
        Since:
        4.9.2
        See Also:
        migrateForAndroidQ(String)

      • migrateForAndroidQ

        public void migrateForAndroidQ​(String applicationId)
                        throws OobException
        Migrate the old data to be compatible with Android Q. In order to retrieve the old data, this API needs the READ_PHONE_STATE permission to be granted. After the migration, the permission is not required anymore.

        For more information on Android Q privacy changes, refer to https://developer.android.com/preview/privacy/data-identifiers#device-ids

        Parameters:
        applicationId - The application ID.
        Throws:
        OobException - When database operation failed.
        Since:
        4.9.2
        See Also:
        isMigrationNeededForAndroidQ(String)

      • getClientIDs

        public Set<String> getClientIDs​(String applicationId)
                         throws OobException
        Retrieve the Set of clientIds for given application ID
        Parameters:
        applicationId - The application ID.
        Returns:
        set of client IDs
        Throws:
        OobException - When the SDK is not able to retrieve the clientIDs. It can be caused by Database IO exception, passwordManager not logged in, or invalid DeviceFingerprint.
        Since:
        4.9.4
